feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:47PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FRONTAL SYSTEM TO BRING TRANSITIONS BETWEEN SNOW, RAIN, AND FREEZING RAIN ON SUNDAY... A front will begin to push inland across Southwest Alaska on Sunday morning bringing with it warmer air. Initial snow is forecast to transition to a rain/freezing rain mix as a result of the warmer air pushing atop at or sub-freezing surface

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:45PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Confidence Continues to Increase for Snowfall Sunday Night through Thursday... A strong frontal boundary is expected to bring snowy conditions for most of the Interior Sunday night and into Monday. Widespread snowfall of 2 to 5 inches possible with locally heavier amounts of 5 to 7 inches west of Fairbanks through Tuesday. A secondary
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 11 at 2:55PM AKST until November 13 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts at higher elevations. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. Light freezing rain from Aniak, south. Ice accumulations of a trace up to a tenth of an inch.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 1:44PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA OVER KODIAK ISLAND THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... Strong northwesterly winds with gusts to 35 mph have resuspended ash from the 1912 Katmai-Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk, Akhiok and Larsen Bay are most likely to be impacted, but ash may be observed on the eastern parts of Kodiak Island as

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 12:41PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Expected Monday Through Tuesday... A strong storm moving through the Chukchi Sea Sunday into Monday will push a surge of water into the northwest Arctic Coast. Persistent south to southwest winds 20 to 30 mph will develop across the Chukchi Sea and result in elevated water levels 1 to 2 feet above the normal high tide line Monday through Tuesday. The
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast
